importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the current state of the postseason in Major League Baseball as of late October 2025.
The scheduled start date of Game 1 of the World Series, marking the beginning of the decisive championship matchup between the Toronto Blue Jays and Los Angeles Dodgers.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe covers the 2025 postseason, including the ALCS and NLCS, during which the Blue Jays and Dodgers advanced to the World Series.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays have won the American League Championship Series against the Seattle Mariners, marking their first World Series appearance since 1993.
The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll in baseball, are the defending champions and are aiming for their first repeat World Series title in over 25 years.
The Dodgers' dominant postseason performance, including Shohei Ohtani's legendary Game 4 NLCS performance, highlights their strength and consistency in high-pressure games.
The Blue Jays' comeback from a 2-0 series deficit in the ALCS and their 34-run offensive outburst in the ALDS show their resilience and offensive power.
The Dodgers' bullpen has been a weakness, potentially offering a tactical opening for the Blue Jays in the World Series.
Game 1 of the 2025 World Series is set for October 24 in Toronto.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are the current champions of the American League and are set to face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, marking their first appearance since 1993.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the defending champions with a strong postseason record and a top-tier payroll, making them a formidable opponent in the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Two-way superstar player for the Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a historic performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, with three home runs as a batter and a 6.1-inning shutout as a pitcher, cementing his role as a pivotal force in the Dodgers' championship run.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the opponents in the ALCS, losing to the Blue Jays in seven games, marking their first time in the World Series in over 30 years.

namedEntities.name: New York Yankees
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Yankees were the division rivals of the Blue Jays during the ALDS, where the Blue Jays outscored them with 34 runs over four games.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were defeated by the Dodgers in the NLDS, with only one win in the series.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were swept by the Dodgers in the NLCS, showing the Dodgers' strength in postseason play.

namedEntities.name: Pittsburgh Pirates
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Major League Baseball (MLB)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Pirates defeated the Dodgers in a September sweep, exposing inconsistencies in the Dodgers' late-season bullpen performance.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Jeff Hoffman, a key pitcher for the Blue Jays, commented on the team's resilience in the ALCS, stating that the team maintained close competition throughout the series.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Player for the Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Springer hit a late three-run home run in Game 7 of the ALCS, ending the Mariners' hopes and securing the Blue Jays' advancement to the World Series.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the 2025 World Series after defeating the Seattle Mariners in a seven-game American League Championship Series, marking their first appearance since 1993. Their opponent is the Los Angeles Dodgers, who are the defending champions with a dominant postseason performance and a record of two World Series titles in recent years. The Dodgers, fueled by the incredible two-way play of Shohei Ohtani and a strong pitching staff, have won multiple series in the postseason. Despite a shaky regular season and bullpen issues, the Dodgers have been unstoppable in the postseason, while the Blue Jays overcame early deficits and a strong Mariners push to reach the championship. The Blue Jays' offense and resilience, combined with potential pressure on the Dodgers' bullpen, may provide a strategic edge in the World Series, which begins on October 24 in Toronto.
title: Dodgers and Blue Jays Set to Face Off in 2025 World Series
